text: In Fortnite, building fast is difficult.

However, there are some
quick and easy ways

to improve your building
speed that you can learn
by following the steps in this video.
To keep track of which step you're on,
use the clickable sections below.
Before learning to build faster,

it helps to have a simple list
of useful building patterns
that you feel comfortable using in-game.

This baseline of common
builds is important
because it's hard to build fast
if you don't know what to build.
To learn those fundamental strategies,

watch our other video on the
basics of building in Fortnite,
linked in the video description below.
Once you have an idea of what to build,
you can start building faster.

But to build faster,
you need to turn faster.

If you can't spin around
quickly enough to build a box,
you'll need to raise your sensitivity.

Open your menu, select the
cogwheel to enter your settings,
and select the fourth column of settings
if you play on mouse and keyboard,

or the fifth column if
you play on controller.

First, try raising your
sensitivity by 25% to 50%.
On a higher sensitivity,

the same movements of
your mouse or joystick

will move your crosshair
much farther than normal.

There are many building
patterns that require

fast snapping movements
and wide-angle turns.

Having a higher sensitivity
helps you move through

those difficult building
patterns without slowing down.

If your sensitivity is
already fast enough,
your building speed may still be limited

by the way you press
your keys and buttons.
For example, when beginner-level players

learn to edit through
floors and cones like this,

they often press their
edit button too hard.
You need to be gentle.
If you press a button with too much force,
it makes it very difficult
to press that button again quickly.
By using a lighter touch,
you can press one button much faster
and you can easily flutter

between your important
building and editing binds.
Even with the right sensitivity
and proper button-pressing technique,
you can still improve your building speed
by training your crosshair efficiency.
When building and editing,

most players move their
crosshair more than they need to.

This extra movement
wastes time and effort.
You can perform the same builds and edits

by making shorter and more
deliberate crosshair movements.
With better crosshair efficiency,
your screen will move less

but your builds and edits
will be much faster.
The last step of building faster
is to learn more advanced strategies

that are meant to be performed
while running full speed.

These strategies are too
in-depth for this video,
but you can search for building patterns

like triple edits or piece
control tunnels to learn more.

And make sure to check
out the Fortnite playlist
on our page for more game tips.
